items.description: Upper Bristol Avon area
items.message:
River levels remain high the Bristol Avon, Tetbury Avon, Sherston Avon, Dauntsey Brook due to rainfall.

Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Bristol Avon, Tetbury Avon, Sherston Avon, Dauntsey Brook, with low lying land expected to be most affected, particularly around the road at Reybridge.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. More rainfall is forecast after the weekend so this alert may stay out for several days. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.

Monitor local water levels and weather conditions. We urge all people to take care and not drive through flood water.

This message will be updated by 11:30 AM on 14/12/2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Trent from Cromwell Weir to Gainsborough
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.

items.description: River Churn and its tributaries

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Churn, Hilcot Brook, Daglingworth Stream, Gumstool Brook

items.message:
"High river levels may lead to flooding. Flooding remains possible.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue today, 13 December 2025, along the River Churn around Cerney Wick. The forecast is for a dry day and night. Levels remain high but stable. We expect river levels to remain high over the coming days.

We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 19:00 13 December 2025 or as the situation changes."

We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.

items.description: Lower Frome and tributaries
items.message: River levels remain high at the Stinsford river gauge on the Lower Frome after recent rainfall. Flooding is forecast to affect low lying areas to start with near to the River Frome in the Dorchester, West Stafford, Bockhampton, Lewell, Tincleton, Pallington, Waddock, Moreton, Wool, East Stoke, Holmebridge, Stoborough, Stoborough Green, Wareham, Redcliffe, Ridge and Swineham areas. The weather is set to continue to improve over the weekend. Some rain is forecast to come in Monday and Tuesday early next week. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this Flood Alert if necessary. Please avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. People in this area should take action now and watch your local weather forecast. This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 15 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Lugg south of Leominster
items.message: River levels remain high due to recent rainfall. Flooding is possible today, 13 December 2025. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the River Lugg south of Leominster from Stoke Prior to Mordiford. Other locations that may be affected include Bodenham, Lugwardine and Hampton Bishop. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 14 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message: Tide locking, where high tides restrict normal drainage of the river out to sea, may lead to flooding today and over the next few days. We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning. River levels may remain high over the next couple of days. Avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. We are closely monitoring the situation. This message will be updated by 10am tomorrow, Sunday 14 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Yeo and River Parrett Moors around Muchelney and Thorney
items.message: The Yeo and Parrett rivers remain high following rainfall on Tuesday. As a result, this Flood Alert remains in force. The remainder of Friday and Saturday and Sunday will be mainly dry. The current river level at Huish Episcopi pumping station is 7.99m and is stable. The current drain level at Huish Episcopi pumping station is 7.28m and is falling. Flooding will affect the road from Langport to Muchelney if this level exceeds 7.3m; the road from Muchelney to Long Load above 7.86m; the road from Muchelney to Thorney above 7.93m and the road from Muchelney to Drayton above 8.8m. We continue to monitor rainfall and river levels. We will commence pumping when river levels allow. Avoid driving through flood water. Refer to the local authority website for any local road closures. This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 13 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message:

Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals.

items.description: River Severn in Gloucestershire
items.message:
High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 13 December 2025.
River levels remain high due to recent rainfall. Flooding may continue over the next few days.
Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent the River Severn from Tewkesbury to Gloucester. Locations that may be affected include Apperley, Maisemore, Hempstead, Minsterworth Ham and Quedgley. Severn Ham, Tewkesbury starts to fill.
Predicted peaks:-
Mythe 3.7m to 3.9m on Saturday afternoon 13/11/25.
Haw Bridge 4.6m to 4.8m on Saturday afternoon 13/11/25.
No flooding is expected at other gauge locations currently.
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours which may see river levels rise further.
We are closely monitoring the situation.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses .
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 14 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Avon in Worcestershire
items.message:
High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 13 December 2025.
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent the River Avon from Abbotts Salford to Tewkesbury. Other locations that may be affected include Offenham, Evesham, Twyning and the Eckington Road. Mill Bank Road from Jubillee Bridge to Fladbury is impacted.
River levels at the Bredon gauge peaked at 2.35m on Thursday 11/12/25.
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours which may see river levels rise further. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 14 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Locations most affected will be local roads and low-lying land near rivers around Stamford Bridge, Pocklington, Wressle, Wilberfoss and Elvington. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and liaising with emergency services and local authorities.  

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.

items.description: Severn Vyrnwy confluence
items.message: River levels remain high but are falling today 13 December 2025. Flooding is possible. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from the Welsh border at Llawnt to Shrawardine near Shrewsbury. Other locations that may be affected include Llanymynech, Maesbrook and Melverley. Roads between Maesbrook, Melverley and Pentre start to flood. Peaks - Llanymynech peaked at 4.60m on Tuesday, Cae Howel peaked at 5.29m on 11/12. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 14 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message:
Levels remain high today, 13th December 2025. 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads around the River Dee at Shocklach, Farndon, Handley, Lower Kinnerton, Chester and Puddington. Townfield Lane is currently impassable. We are not expecting to issue flood warnings.  
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. 
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 14th December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Severn in Worcestershire
items.message:
High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 13 December 2025.
Flooding may affect low lying land & roads adjacent to the river from Highley to Tewkesbury; including Dog Lane Bewdley, Stourport, Diglis & Hylton Road towpath. Flooded drains affect the racecourse & Worcester CCG. PLP should be installed. New St Gate closed at Upton upon Severn.
Predicted peaks:-
Bewdley peaked at 3.49m on Friday, 12/12/25.
Worcester 4.0m to 4.2m on Saturday evening, 13/12/25.
Diglis 3.7m to 3.9m on Saturday evening, 13/12/25.
Kempsey Yacht Club 5.8m to 6.0m Saturday evening, 13/12/25.
Saxons Lode 4.4m to 4.6m on Saturday evening, 13/12/25.
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours which may see river levels rise further. We are closely monitoring the situation. 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. 
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 14 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Ouse, Burdyke, Holgate Beck, Blue Beck, River Foss, The Fleet

items.message:
River Ouse levels in York have peaked but remain high.  As a result, flooding is possible today, Saturday 13th December 2025.

Locations most affected will be riverside footpaths and low-lying land in York and to the south as far as Naburn Lock, including Kings Staith, Queens Staith, and South Esplanade. River levels are falling slowly. We are closely monitoring the situation and are operating the Foss Barrier. 

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. 

This message will be updated by 8:00 PM on Saturday 13th December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Severn in Shropshire
items.message: River levels remain high but are falling, however the risk of flooding continues. Flooding is possible on 13 December 2025 and may continue over the next few days. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent the river from Shrewsbury to Upper Arley. Locations that may be affected are White Abbey, Coalbrookdale, Ironbridge and Bridgnorth. River Severn bank full at White Abbey, floodplain may be filling at Hayes Basin. Peaks:- Montford peaked at 5.63m overnight Wednesday 10/12, Welsh Bridge peaked at 3.22m 11/12 PM, Buildwas peaked at 4.39m 12/12, Bridgnorth peaked at 3.67m 12/12. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 14 December 2025 or as the situation changes

items.description: Groundwater flooding in the West of Dorset
items.message:
Rising groundwater levels may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible in the West Dorset area
Groundwater levels are rising in response to recent heavy rainfall. Levels may continue to rise and flooding of fields and roads is possible. Levels are reactive to further rainfall. Some further rainfall is expected Friday and across the weekend which may see levels react further.  Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding.  We are closely monitoring the situation . Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed. 
This message will be updated by 4:00PM on 16 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Rivers Brathay, Rothay and Winster

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Brathay, River Rothay, River Winster

items.message:
The water levels in rivers and Windermere remain high following heavy rainfall at the start of the week.  Further heavy rainfall is forecast from Saturday (13/12/2025 ) evening until Monday (15/12/2025), which will cause the water levels to rise significantly and may lead to Flood Warnings being issued.
Avoid using low lying footpaths near watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 14/12/2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message:
River and lakes levels will start to rise this evening (13/12/2025), with heavy and persistent rain forecast until Monday 15/12/2025.  It is very likely that the Flood Warning for Keswick Campsite will be issued over the weekend.

Avoid using low lying footpaths near watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 14/12/2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Piddle and tributaries
items.message: Heavy rainfall over the last few days keeps the river level high at the Briantspuddle gauge station. Flooding of roads and low lying land is possible. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Piddle, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around tributaries between Alton Pancras and Wareham. The weather is set to continue to improve over the weekend. There is  rain forecast Tuesday next week. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Consider activating any flood protection products you may have and monitor local water levels and weather conditions. This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 15 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message:
Levels on the Holderness Drain remain high. As a result, flooding is possible today, Saturday 13th December 2025.

Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers in the Holderness Drain area, including Leven and Bransholme. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels, operating pumping stations and liaising with emergency services and local authorities.  

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. 
                                                                                                                    
This message will be updated by 8:00PM on Saturday 13th December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Foulness and Market Weighton catchment

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Foulness, Market Weighton Canal, North Cave Beck, Ellerker Beck, Mill Beck

items.message:
River levels remain high. As a result, flooding is possible today, Saturday 13th December 2025.

Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near the River Foulness and the Market Weighton Canal and their tributaries, particularly around Welham Bridge. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and liaising with emergency services and local authorities. 

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Monitor local water levels and weather conditions. 

This message will be updated by 8:00PM on Saturday 13th December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Derwent at Buttercrambe Mill
items.message:
River levels remain high on the River Derwent at Buttercrambe. Levels have peaked at Buttercrambe, and will continue to slowly fall today, Saturday 13th December 2025. However, levels are likely to remain high into the weekend.
Locations most affected will be Buttercrambe Mill at Buttercrambe Bridge. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and liaising with emergency services and local authorities. 
Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals .  
This message will be updated by 03:00PM on Saturday 13th December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Derwent at Stamford Bridge - The Weir Caravan Park and Kexby Bridge

floodArea.county: East Riding of Yorkshire, North Yorkshire

items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
If you have been evacuated only return to your property once the emergency services have advised that it is safe to do so. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: Minor Watercourses from Heighington to Dunston
items.message: High river levels today, Saturday, may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 13th December 2025. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Our forecasts indicate that flooding to properties is not likely and therefore flood warnings are not expected to be issued. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded. This message will be updated by 11:00am on Sunday 14th December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Yeo and Parrett, The Levels

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Yeo, River Parrett, Kings Sedgemoor Drain, River Sowy

items.message: Levels remain high on the Rivers Yeo and Parrett following rainfall on Tuesday. River and drain levels are still high in the lowland areas around Huish Episcopi, Langport, the River Sowy and King's Sedgemoor. The remainder of Friday and Saturday and Sunday will be mainly dry. This flood alert will remain in force whilst levels remain high. Flooding will affect areas near the Rivers Yeo, Parrett, Kings Sedgemoor Drain and Sowy, with low lying land and roads most affected, including Westover Trading Estate at Langport. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. We are checking defences, bridges, culverts and screens. We will commence pumping when river levels allow. Take care and avoid driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 1.00PM on 13 December 2025 or as the situation changes.
